How to add Static Route to NIM server

  1. In order to reach the systems we moved to fmmotorparts.com, we had to setup this static route.
  2. First check from NIM server whether the destination IP network is available or not
    netstat -rn
    1. If yes then you are good to go.
    2. If no then please do the following.
      sudo chdev -l inet0 -a route=net,-netmask,255.255.255.0,,static IP,NIMbck gateway

      e.g. 

      sudo chdev -l inet0 -a route=net,-netmask,255.255.255.0,,10.128.40.0,10.32.60.1
  3. After the above step please check once.
    lsattr -El inet0

    the output will look something like this 

    authm         65536                                              Authentication Methods              True
bootup_option no                                                 Use BSD-style Network Configuration True
gateway                                                          Gateway                             True
hostname      pgnmsv01                                           Host Name                           True
rout6                                                            IPv6 Route                          True
route         net,-netmask,255.255.255.0,,10.128.40.0,10.32.60.1 Route                               True
route         net,-hopcount,0,,0,10.0.48.1                       Route                               True
